main event: A brilliant white light was sighted by 11 people in Darlington and Monroe, Wisc.
interesting points: The object appeared low in the Eastern sky and rose to approximately 60Â° elevation before disappearing., The object was reported as traveling extremely fast and illuminated the landscape., The sighting lasted for about 8 hours., Project personnel visited the sighting area on June 17, 1953., The object closely paralleled the course of Venus on the date of the sighting.
sighted object: a brilliant white light in the sky
witness description: local residents in Darlington and Monroe
